result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] was dismissed by the court.

  • Robert A Lorenz was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

timeConds.notes: Huber privileges subject to jail policies.  Good time allowed.  Huber to include medical treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert A Lorenz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Two discharge certificates filed by DOC
Defendant discharged from probation on 7-18-17; no unpaid financial obligations

Defendant Robert A Lorenz in court with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Rights/Elements, Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 1, Judgment to be entered, Ct. 2 dismissed, Court withholds sentence, probation 3 years, $2,452.00 fine/costs and $250.00 DNA Surcharge and sample, payment plan to be set today, 10 months jail w/Huber, Huber to include medical treatment, 36 month D.L. Revocation, 36 month ignition interlock device, AODA and comply, DNA Sample, not possess/consume acoholic beverages, 1 day sentence credit, Defendant is eligible for Good Time, Jail start date to commence today 7/18/14 at 4:30 P.M.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 18, 2014 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Robert A Lorenz in court with attorney Mark Lawton.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over. Information filed, reading waived. Defendant stood mute. Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set. Bond continued.
Columbia County Request for Legal Blood Draw Reimbursement of $65.00.
Pre-trial conference on March 10, 2014 at 03:10 pm.
Maintain absolute sobriety.  Not to possess or consume alcoholic beverages  Not operate motor vehicle at all, standard felony conditions.

Defendant Robert A Lorenz by video, in custody with attorney Amanda Riek.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. $5000.00 signature bond,   Maintain absolute sobriety.  Not to possess or consume alcoholic beverages.  Not operate motor vehicle at all. Standard felony conditions, waives time limits.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 10, 2014 at 01:40 pm.  Hearing scheduled for March 27, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
